title: Jose's Shrimp Ceviche Recipe
description: Jose's shrimp ceviche recipe is made with lime juice, diced veggies, and jalapeño. It makes a zesty appetizer. Serve with tortilla chips or on a tostada.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Recipes Shrimp Dip Recipes Jose's Shrimp Ceviche 4.7 (115) 91 Reviews 34 Photos I've searched the web, high and low, and haven't found a shrimp ceviche recipe quite like this one! My friends absolutely love it and beg me for the recipe! You can always double it for larger parties — it goes fast! Serve it as a dip with tortilla chips or on a tostada spread with mayo. The fearless palate might like this with hot sauce. Submitted by carrielee Updated on April 2, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 34 34 34 34 Prep Time: 45 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 55 mins Servings: 20 Yield: 7 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 20 servings 1 pound peeled and deveined medium shrimp 1 cup fresh lime juice 10 plum tomatoes, diced 2 avocados, diced (Optional) 2 ribs celery, diced (Optional) 1 large yellow onion, diced 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced, or to taste chopped fresh cilantro to taste salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Place shrimp in a large glass or other non-reactive bowl; cover with lime juice to marinate (cook) until turn pink and opaque, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, avocados, celery, onion, and jalapeño in a separate large glass or other non-reactive bowl. Remove shrimp from lime juice; reserve juice. Dice shrimp; add to bowl with vegetables. Add reserved lime juice and cilantro; season with salt and black pepper. Toss gently to combine. I Made It Print 286 home cooks made it! name: carrielee
instructions: Place shrimp in a large glass or other non-reactive bowl; cover with lime juice to marinate (cook) until turn pink and opaque, about 10 minutes.;Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, avocados, celery, onion, and jalapeño in a separate large glass or other non-reactive bowl.;Remove shrimp from lime juice; reserve juice. Dice shrimp; add to bowl with vegetables. Add reserved lime juice and cilantro; season with salt and black pepper. Toss gently to combine.
